thread.title: Children’s Books: Safety and Comfort in Numbers

author: Meghan Cox Gurdon
title: Children’s Books: Safety and Comfort in Numbers
text:
‘I think we all have empathy,” the poet Maya Angelou remarked, but “we may not have enough courage to display it.” The tension between seeing another’s suffering and mustering the bravery to do something about it intensifies and is resolved in the sweet, wordless pages of “I Walk With Vanessa” (Schwartz & Wade, 40 pages, $17.99), a picture book by the husband-and-wife creative team known as Kerascoët “about a simple act of kindness.”
We have a bird’s-eye view of lots of small children in Kerascoët’s spacious ink-and-watercolor...
